Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I'm going to share

with you my spatchchcocked - if you will - roast
chicken that I'm going to serve with a delicious

dill chimichurri and we're going to also make
a little bit of a wine sauce to drizzle on

top to keep it super flavorful and delicious,
I love this recipe, it has become our go-to

family roast chicken recipe, I made it recently
for Joe's birthday dinner, if you follow me

on Instagram you would have already seen it,
it's fantastic and I wanted to share it with

you because it's sort of like an updated roast
chicken that I've been making for a long time

now and I like the spatchcocked idea which
is basically just butterflying the chicken,
I already have it done.

But all you do is you take out the backbone,
and then you put your cut chicken cut side

down and then you press it on the breast to
break the bone.

You can do it yourself or you can also ask
your butcher to do it, if you buy your meat

at your local grocery store, every grocery
store that I know of in the US anyway, has

a meat department, if your chicken is already
pre-packed you can take that chicken to your

meat guy and be like 'hey, my friend, Fred,
how you doin?
Can you spatchcock this for me?

Can you take out the backbone?' and they will
do that!

And they will also give you the backbone so
that you can use it in stocks and things like

that, so if you find it intimidating to do
it yourself, ask your butcher to do it for
you.

So I have it in my big pan here, you want
to use a pan that you can go from oven to

oil underneath, so what I'm going to do now,

this could not be easier, it could not be
simpler but it is absolutely phenomenal.

I just take lemons, I also take a whole head

right underneath, this is going to give you
lots of flavor and it's also going to give

you lots of flavor when you go to make your
gravy.

And then a couple of onions, like I said,
I don't peel because I will be straining the

juices anyway and the skins will give the
sauce a really good color.

I've got my oven preheated to 425F I like
a lot of high heat for this.

It's only going to be in there for an hour

course.

Just put all your goodness around it, take
